STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 25, 2025
Lauryn Ritchie
Let's Talk About it Girl's Home III
615 W. Lovell,
Kalamazoo, MI, 49007
Re: License #: CI390403045
SI #: 2025SIC0000787
Dear Lauryn Ritchie:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan must be completed and routed in CWLM. If you desire technical assistance in
addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
427 East Alcott St.
Kalamazoo, MI 49001
(269) 251-2471
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000787
Special Investigation Intake Date: June 11, 2025
License #: CI390403045
Licensee Group Organization: Let's Talk About It CMH Services, PLLC
Licensee Designee: Tonya Moore
Chief Administrator: Lauryn Ritchie
Agency Name: Let's Talk About it Girl's Home III
Agency Address: 615 W. Lovell
Kalamazoo, MI 49007
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/17/2026
Capacity: 14
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
7/14/2025 Phone Attempted contact
7/9/2025 Documentation MDHHS – Findings
7/8/2025 Email Incident Notification
7/8/2025 Email Incident Notification
7/7/2025 Video Conference MDHHS Disposition held.
7/2/2025 Text Attempted contact
6/30/2025 Phone Attempted contact
6/16/2025 Email Documentation received or sent
6/16/2025 Email Attempted contact
6/16/2025 Phone Attempted contact
6/16/2025 Face to Face Attempted contact
6/13/2025 Face to Face Interview
6/11/2025 Email Documentation received or sent
1

6/11/2025 Face to Face Entrance Conference; Incident
Notification; Special Investigation
Initiation
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements;
Section staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or about 06/09/2025 at approximately 8:34pm, Staff 2 supplied
Youth A and Youth B with THC (possibly gummies), unknown how
much was given to them or how much was consumed. Staff 2 is
no longer a staff person at Let's Talk About It as of 06/10/2025;
Youth A and Youth B remain at the facility. No other details are
known at this time.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on 6/11/2025. She
reported being informed by Youth C about the allegations of Youth
A and Youth B receiving “gummies” from Staff 2. She reported
Staff 2 was terminated immediately and legal charges were filed.
Administrator 1 reported Law Enforcement has interviewed Youth
A, Youth B, and Staff 2. She reported the interactions took place
outside of the building and out of camera view.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face with MDHHS Worker at
the facility on 6/13/2025. Youth C reported overhearing Youth A
and Youth B talk about wanting “weed” and Staff 2 told Youth A
and Youth B that Staff 2 had a “half” at home. Youth C reported
Youth A and Youth B responded with “yea bring some in”. Youth C
reported later Youth C again overheard Youth A and Youth B
saying Staff 2 was going to bring in “weed” for Youth A and Youth
B. Youth C reported the night Staff 2 brought in “weed”, both
Youth A and Youth B went for a walk with Staff 2 but Staff 2
grabbed her purse before leaving the facility with Youth A and
Youth B. Youth C reported when Youth A and Youth B returned
from the walk, both stated being very hungry even though they ate
prior to going on the “20-minute walk”. Youth C described Youth B
as being tired and moving around “funny”. Youth C reported later
in the evening, Youth B informed Youth C that Youth B received
four gummies (200 mg each) from Staff 2 and Youth B took one.
However, Youth B informed Youth C that the next day, Youth B
took the other three. Youth C reported being told by Youth B that
Youth A took one the day of the walk and took two at the doctor’s
2

office the next day. Youth B informed Youth C that Youth B
doesn’t know what happened to the fourth gummy that was given
to Youth A. Youth C struggled to remember the specific day that
Youth A and Youth B went for a walk but believed it was a
Thursday or Friday. Youth C reported nothing like this has
happened at the facility in the past.
Administrator 1, Administrator 2, and Administrator 3 were
interviewed face-to-face with MDHHS Worker at the facility on
6/13/2025. They reported Staff 2 worked her first shift on Sunday
6/8/25 and the walk Youth A and Youth B went on occurred on
Monday 6/9/25. They reported this was the first week Staff 2 was
going to work without shadowing another staff since Staff 2 was
recently hired and just completed the shadowing aspect of her
orientation and training. They reported contacting Law
Enforcement and provided the number of the Police Report. They
reported both Youth A and Youth B were taken to a local hospital
for a drug test and both Youth A and Youth B tested positive for
THC. Administrator 2 reported calling Staff 2 the day
administration found out about Staff 2 giving edibles to Youth A
and Youth B and informing Staff 2 that she was terminated.
Administrator 2 reported Staff 2’s response was only “ok”. She
informed Staff 2 that a police report was filed. Administrator 2 was
asked about drug testing as part of the hiring process and
reported the facility doesn’t drug test because Marijuana is legal at
this time.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face with MDHHS Worker at
the facility on 6/13/2025. Youth B reported understanding the
reason for the interview. Youth B reported that Youth B and Youth
A were waiting for Staff 2 to come to work at 8:00 pm and when
Staff 2 arrived, Youth A and Youth B began talking about “edibles”
with Staff 2. Youth B reported Staff 2 informed Youth A and Youth
B that Staff 2 would get some edibles for both of them. Youth B
reported Staff 2 showed pictures of edibles on Staff 2’s cell phone
and Youth A went through the pictures looking at the prices of
edibles. Staff 2 informed Youth A and Youth B that it would have
to be edibles because Staff 2 didn’t want Youth A and Youth B
smelling of “weed” and told Youth A and Youth B that Staff 2 will
bring in edibles for them tomorrow (unsure of date). Youth B
reported Staff 2 came to work the next day without the edibles and
told Youth A and Youth B that Staff 2 didn’t pick up the edibles.
However, the next day, Staff 2 brought the edibles, and Youth A
and Youth B asked Staff 2 to take them for a walk. Staff 2 wanted
to get them away from the house and cameras. Youth B reported
during the walk, Staff 2 gave Youth A and Youth B four edibles
3

each and Youth A and Youth B both took one at 8:00 pm. Youth B
reported hiding the other three edibles in Youth B’s clothing. Youth
B reported walking around until the edible kicked in about 10-12
minutes later and then started walking back to the facility. Youth B
reported throwing the packaging under a porch on an old house
on the way back to the facility. Upon returning to the facility, Youth
B reported having the “munchies” and wanting to eat. Youth B
reported taking the last three edibles the next day and believes
Youth A took two before going to the Family Health Center the
next day. Youth B doesn’t know what Youth A did with the fourth
edible. Youth B reported Administrator 1 spoke with Youth B the
next day and knew that Youth B had taken edibles but doesn’t
know how Administrator 1 found out. Youth B reported telling
Administrator 1 where Youth B threw the package and walking
with Administrator 1 and finding the package where Youth B threw
it. Youth B reported feeling safe at the facility and doesn’t believe
Staff 2 gave any edibles or weed to other youth in the program.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face with MDHHS Worker at
the facility on 6/13/2025. Youth A reported understanding why
Youth A was being interviewed. Youth A reported thinking about
Youth A’s son’s birthday so Youth A believed it would be a good
time to get high. Youth A reported Staff 2 told Youth A that Staff 2
had a “whole half” at time. Youth A jokingly asked Staff 2 to bring
“some” for Youth A and Staff 2 said she would bring edibles for
Youth A. Youth A reported, Youth B then said Youth B wants
some edibles also. Youth A reported Staff 2 provided her cell
phone so Youth A could look at which edibles Youth A would
want. Youth A reported Staff 2 came to work and gave Youth A
and Youth B both four edibles but was unable to identify a specific
date. Youth A reported both Youth A and Youth B took one edible
each on a walk away from the facility and Youth A gave Staff 2
$5.00 for the edibles. Youth A reported returning to the facility,
eating some food, and going to bed around 11:00pm to 12:00am.
Youth A reported taking two more edibles the next day at the
doctor’s office. Youth A reported Staff 2 informed Youth A that
Staff 2 had taken two edibles before coming to work the day of the
walk. Youth A reported feeling safe at the facility. Youth A never
disclosed where the final gummy went.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone call with MDHHS Worker at
the facility on 6/13/2025. She reported being the Lead Youth
Specialist for the past year and a half and working with Staff 2 last
Thursday (6/5/2025). She reported speaking with Youth A and
Youth B who informed her that they didn’t like Staff 2. Staff 1
believes youth will use walks as a calming activity and found
4

nothing out of the ordinary of the youth going for a walk. Staff 1
reported Staff 2 came into work at 8:00 pm the day of the walk
and the walk occurred between 8:00pm and 9:00 pm, lasting
about 15 minutes.
Contacts were attempted with Staff 2 as follows:
• 6/13/25: contact at residence without contact.
• 6/16/25: contact at residence without contact.
• 6/16/25: phone call with no answer.
• 6/16/25: email sent with no response.
• 6/30/25: phone call with no answer.
• 7/2/25: text message requesting contact but no response.
• 7/14/25: phone call with no answer.
Because the incident occurred off camera there is no video
recording to be reviewed.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident/Investigation Report Kalamazoo Department of
Public Safety Case Number 25-007108 Dated 6/12/25. This
document outlines Law Enforcements assessment of the situation
with Staff 2, Youth A, and Youth B. Staff 2 is identified as the
offender. It is documented that Staff 2 informed Law Enforcement
she provided Youth A and Youth B with marijuana gummies. It is
documented Staff 2 never admitted to the facility that she provided
the gummies to Youth A and Youth B, she admitted this only to
Law Enforcement. It is documented Staff 2 felt sorry for Youth A
and Youth B being away from family and struggling emotionally as
the reasons she supplied the gummies to Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 2 is documented as picking up the marijuana at an unnamed
dispensary before arriving at the facility. Staff 2 is documented as
taking Youth A and Youth B for a walk and away from the facility
before giving the substance to Youth A and Youth B. Staff 2
reported wanting to be a friend to Youth A and Youth B and
feeling bad for Youth A and Youth B because Youth A and Youth
B are not having fun at the facility. It is documented that this case
will be sent to the prosecutors office.
LTAI Incident Report dated 6/10/25 at 8:19 pm for Youth A.
This document outlines Youth A being taken to the Emergency
Room for medical clearance after the report of Staff 2 giving Youth
A THC Gummies (edibles).
5

LTAI Incident Report dated 6/10/25 at 8:19 pm for Youth B.
This document outlines Youth B being taken to the Emergency
Room for medical clearance after the report of Staff 2 giving Youth
A THC Gummies (edibles).
After Visit Summary Bronson dated 6/10/25 for Youth A. This
document indicates Youth A tested positive for a Cannabinoid
Screen with levels of 50 ng/ml and higher.
After Visit Summary Bronson dated 6/10/25 for Youth B. This
document indicates Youth B tested positive for a Cannabinoid
Screen with levels of 50 ng/ml and higher.
LTAI Policy – Drug Free Workplace dated 1/7/20. The purpose
of this policy is to provide a safe and drug-free environment for the
youth in the program. Procedure explicitly prohibits staff being
impaired or under the influence of legal of illegal drugs and
possession, use, solicitation for or sale of legal drugs.
HR file for Staff 2 was reviewed. Documentation indicates Staff
2 was hired on 5/19/25 and there is no disciplinary action
documented in the file with the exception of her termination for the
incident outlined in the allegations. Staff 2 was up to date on her
required trainings and had completed orientation, three shadow
(observation) shifts, and just began working shifts as a direct staff.
Walk-through:
A walk-through was completed at the facility. The facility is an
older three-story home near downtown Kalamazoo Michigan.
There is regular maintenance on the facility and because of it’s
age, there is a need for regular maintenance. The facility is
appropriately furnished in all aspects.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as evidenced by interviews
with staff, youth, and documents reviewed. Evidence strongly
supports the allegation of Staff 2 providing marijuana gummies to
Youth A and Youth B since youths admitted to the allegations and
Law Enforcement report documents Staff 2’s admission.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered regarding this situation. The
facility reports not drug testing employees since marijuana is
currently legal in the State of Michigan. It was suggested they
6

either begin drug testing possible employees or at the minimum
question the potential employee about use of marijuana.
Technical assistance was offered regarding the importance of staff
understanding their role at the facility. Staff should understand
their primary role is as a healing agent. Staff should understand
they can develop an emotional bond to these youth but must
guard themselves from a destructive bond which negatively
impact youth. This should be a topic at each staff meeting and
staff should be keeping each other in check on this topic.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
7/15/25
______________________________________
Paul Fatato Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
7/25/2025
________________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
